author: potuz
content: Thanks for the report <@412614104222531604> I think we did discuss this issue long ago, don't remember what was the decision, perhaps <@884836500037066862> does?

author: barnabasbusa
content: Testing besu/teku with the existing chain (with no validators).  Teku seems to be able to do optimistic sync, but besu failed to peer with anyone, keeps dropping the peers even though I have static peer definitions.  New besu node is at `142.93.108.142`

author: barnabasbusa
content: Besu was launched with `"shanghaiBlock": 54,`

author: barnabasbusa
content: http://164.92.243.41:8080/block/54 is slot 128 (epoch 4, capella trigger)

author: barnabasbusa
content: Its a besu issue more like

author: potuz
content: Yeah I imagine, you can try Besu with other CL to check

author: barnabasbusa
content: I was thinking about not spinning up another besu instance, till peering is resolved.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Besu image was updated yesterday by <@341574016160497665> which might have broken the peering. I have the older image running on the post merge chain where peering works. I wanna keep this besu image running on the pre merge chain, so they can take a look and troubleshoot and try to find out what might be broken.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Teku did fully sync up btw, now just waiting for the EL.

content: hi <@412614104222531604> looks like there's a new testnet? Can I sync and test a few things? Is the latest config still here? https://github.com/ethpandaops/withdrawals-testnet/tree/withdrawals/withdrawals-testnet/custom_config_data

content: Feel free to test anything sure

author: terencechain
content: <@412614104222531604> I cant find any peers. Are we working on `1337803` or `1337804`? I just ssh'ed to `withdrawals-prysm-geth-1` and the dockers are still running `1337803`

author: barnabasbusa
content: 803 is the one you looking for.

author: barnabasbusa
content: 803 is pre merged genesis.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Which EL you running with? You might want to specify static nodes to peer with prysm. Static nodes enr can be found here: https://github.com/ethpandaops/withdrawals-testnet/blob/withdrawals/withdrawals-testnet/inventory/group_vars/all.yaml#L44

author: barnabasbusa
content: Yeah and use the config.yml and static nodes for peer discovery.
